column4: I would've realized after about the 2nd time reinstalling that the codecs arent going to work if i installed the OS again 30 more times...
I remember having to download a bunch of codecs and extracting them into the codec directory..
hey does anyone know a good distro (with a decent UI, preferably XFCE) for a AMD 350mhz laptop with 96mb ram? Damn Small is kind of not enough.. thanks
any distro really, try fluxbox or another of the lighter window environments
what I like about Ubuntu is that it's newb friendly, automatic updates, nice installer, etc. I'd like a similiar setup, but with XFCE, I suppose. Fluxbox is kind of not enough
this is for someone coming from wnidows
want to be able to show them some basic stuff and have them be on their own
maybe check out lighter weight browsers and applications too shad0w1e
as firefox tends to use lots of ram :)
but it works with every page...
i find opera/ ephiphany to be quite light weight ( depends on load really ) but at my mums i use a k6-2 350 with 128meg ram and it runs great with opera
pretty much my setup, a drop less ram. thanks opera might be good
